div.p: The epoxide hydrolase from potato is significantly different from the two EHs that have previously be solved in our laboratory. It is most similar (amino-acid sequence identity ~30%) to the mammalian enzymes for which the structures are known. One data set was collected for the apo enzyme, with R-merge ~7%, which has allowed the structure to be solved by molecular replacement. It is now being refined at 2.1 Ã… resolution. We will use this structure to work toward a better understanding of the different substrate specificities observed for the various enzymes, and also as the template for directed evolution experiments intended to provide new enzymes with novel specificities.
